result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie Lee Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant to report to Probation tomorrow September 16, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Court has no objection to Probation being transferred to Minnesota, but will have to sign up in St. Croix County.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

pprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Arne Richard Skatrud DF: Jamie Lee Hayes appeared. Case called at  Includes 15CM433, 15CM194.  ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. Skatrud agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 15CM433 and 15CM194 removing the repeater. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2  in 15CM433 and 15CM194 removing the repeater. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses without objection Ct 1 and 3 in 15CM433. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: On 15CM194 Sentence W/H
-1 year probation with conditions:
- Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kelly D. Jr.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- Costs along with costs of supervision to be paid through probation. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Maintain mental health treatment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Any additional programing as directed by the agent. 

On 15CM433 
1 year probation to run concurrent with 15CM194
- Costs
- same conditions as 15CM433  

DE to report to probation by 4:00 tomorrow.   
Court has no objection to probation being transferred to MN, but DE will have to sign up in St. Croix County.
Jury trial at 10-28-2015 08:00 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Arne Richard Skatrud DF: Jamie Lee Hayes appeared. Case called at 9:20. Atty. Skatrud requests to set for trial. Cut off for agreements Oct. 14. Motions in limine, jury instructions and verdict forms due by Oct. 21 2015. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Plea hearing on July 13, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Final pre-trial on June 25, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud DF: Jamie Lee Hayes appeared. Case called at 4:22.  ADA McKinley updates the court. Discovery has been provided and requests another PTC. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Filed by Atty Skatrud. km
Appointing Atty Skatrud. km
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kelly D. Jr.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Jamie Lee Hayes appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Mckinley. km
